   "body_snippet": "<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->\r\nSometime it is  happen I open a lot of connections in different folders and subfolders.\r\n## Expected Behavior\r\n\r\n<!--- If you're suggesting a change/improvement, tell us how it should work -->\r\nWhen I click right mouse button on the picture of folder I should see item Close all child connections and Close connections in current folder\r\n## Current Behavior\r\nI see only Item Disconnect\r\n## Your Environment\r\n<!--- Include as many r...",

+      "description": "Folder disconnect only closes direct child connections, not connections in sub-folders — needs recursive traversal"

+  "last_synced": "2026-02-17T13:38:37Z",
+  "notes": "AI triage (claude): Folder disconnect only closes direct child connections, not connections in sub-folders — needs recursive traversal\nApproach: In DisconnectConnection(), when handling ContainerInfo, recursively traverse all descendant containers (not just direct children) to disconnect all connections. Use ContainerInfo.GetRecursiveChildList() or implement a recursive helper to find all ConnectionInfo descendants with open connections."
 }
